document.docAuthor: Rodrigues, Everton Nei Lopes & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.masterDocTitle: On the spider genus Thymoites in the Neotropical Region (Araneae, Theridiidae): nine new species, complementary descriptions and new records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the spider genus Thymoites in the Neotropical Region (Araneae, Theridiidae): nine new species, complementary descriptions and new records

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Brontosauriella melloleitaoni
Bristowe, 1938
: 72
, f. 8–13 (Male holotype from “Santa Catharina ”, Brazil , deposited in The Natural History Museum, London, not examined).
Levi & Levi, 1962
: 48
, f. 131–132 .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. The female of
Thymoites melloleitaoni
Bristowe, 1938
is close to
T. mirus
Levi, 1964
(see
Levi, 1964
: fig. 32, 33), by elongated spermathecae ( Figs. 47, 48 ), but differs from it in the shape of fertilization ducts and copulatory ducts ( Figs. 47, 48 ).

Male. Described by
Bristowe ( 1938 )
and illustrated by
Levi ( 1964 : figs. 35, 36)
.
Distribution. Brazil (São Paulo, Paraná, Santa Catarina and Rio Grande do Sul).
